ch.dermitza.securenio.socket

Class PlainSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.dermitza.securenio.socket.PlainSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SocketIF

    public final class PlainSocket
extends java.lang.Object
implements SocketIF
    A plain socket implementation of SocketIF. As a plain socket behaves no different than a SocketChannel, this class can also be seen as a wrapper with no additional functionality. Note that this class is declared as final as it should NOT be extended.

    All required methods from SocketIF that deal with the secure implementation (SecureSocket) have no effect in this implementation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlainSocket

        public PlainSocket(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel)
        Create a plain socket (i.e. no encryption) instance of the SocketIF interface. This instance has empty placeholder methods for the SSL/TLS-related methods.
        Parameters:
        channel - The associated underlying SocketChannel.

      • getSocket

        public java.nio.channels.SocketChannel getSocket()

      • processHandshake

        public void processHandshake()
        Empty implementation satisfying SocketIF.processHandshake(). No handshaking is present on a PlainSocket. This method has NO effect.
        Specified by:
        processHandshake in interface SocketIF
        See Also:
        SecureSocket.processHandshake()

        public boolean handshakePending()

        Returns:
